title: Keweenaw National Historical Park: Guided Tours
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Guided Tours              Guided Tours        Visitors learn about the area's history on a guided tour of Calumet. NPS Photo       Keweenaw National Historical Park offers Ranger-guided programs in both park units as staffing allows in the summer season.      2016 Season Ranger Programs  Calumet Walking Tour (Wednesdays and Saturdays at 2pm, July 6th-September 24th) Join a Ranger on this free walking tour of the former Calumet & Hecla Copper Mining Company's industrial area and or Calumet's historic downtown. The program is approximately 1 hour, .5-1.5 miles, and on easy terrain. Please be prepared for changing weather. It is accessible with assistance. These programs will meet at the Calumet Visitor Center, 98 Fifth Street in Calumet at 2:00 pm est. It is suggested that you speak with a Ranger at the Calumet Visitor Center for up-to-date program information and start locations. Quincy Ruins Walk (Thursdays at 2pm, July 7th-August 18th) Join a Park Ranger for a free guided walking tour of the surface ruins of the Quincy Copper Mining Company at 2:00 pm est on Thursdays. The program is approximately 1 hour and 1 mile on varied terrain. Please be prepared for changing weather. These programs leave from the Quincy NPS information desk; this tour is not accessible.             Please note: Ranger-guided programs may be canceled due to adverse weather or staffing shortages caused by emergencies. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
